full_summary:
# NMSO Pursuit Tires Government Tender Announcement

### Project Overview
The Government of Canada seeks to establish a National Master Standing Offer (NMSO) for the procurement of pursuit tires for Federal Government Departments and Provincial/Territorial Identified Users across Canada.

#### Requirements
- **Proposal Period**: 11,500 pursuit tires per year, spanning from April 1, 2023 to March 31, 2024.
- The NMSO shall exclude installation and maintenance services.
- A Competitive Request for Standing Offer is being issued.

### Tender Details

| **Key Information** | **Description** |
| --- | --- |
| **Solicitation Number** | WS3751363662 |
| **Tender Closing Date** | March 16, 2023 at 2:00 PM ET |
| **Expected Contract Start Date** | April 1, 2023 |
| **Trade Agreements** | Canada-Ukraine Free Trade Agreement (CUFTA) and others, see attached |
| **Regions of Delivery** | National Capital Region (NCR), Canada, Ontario, Alberta, New Brunswick, Newfoundland and Labrador, Manitoba, Quebec, Nova Scotia, British Columbia, Saskatchewan, and Prince Edward Island. |
| **Contact Information** | Baderllama Salouane, baderllama.salouane@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca, PSU |

### Important Details
- Respondents must have a Canadian Business Number (BN) or Canadian Goods and Services Tax (GST) number.
- Submission must be in English or French.
- All bids must conform to the solicitation documents, including the tender package which is available on the Bid Opportunities webpage.

### How to Access Tender Documents
Documents related to this tender are available on the [link to discovery ariba website page as included in the text, fetched at Jan 12 12:19:08]. 

The deadline for bids to be submitted is March 16, 2023 at 14:00. Respondents should allow sufficient time for file transfer to ensure submission prior to this deadline. If you are experiencing issues accessing the site, please contact Bid Walk-in Desk at (819) 956-6525 for assistance. 

Due to the one-year duration of the contract, only standing situation bids submittals from qualified respondents reflecting the specifics of procurement during this one year term, including breakdowns with costing, branded uplift and layoffs, cannot be accepted.
